node.title: Mac-Specific Implementation Strategy
node.comment: Focused implementation plan for Mac platform targeting direct competition with MacWhisper. Emphasizes native Mac integration, performance optimization, and user experience patterns that Mac users expect from professional applications.

node.title: Native Mac Integration Foundation
node.comment: Implement deep Mac system integration that makes VoiceFlow feel like a native Mac application rather than a cross-platform port. These features create switching costs and user loyalty.

node.title: macOS System Framework Integration
node.comment: Leverage native macOS frameworks for superior performance and integration. Use Core Audio for better audio handling, AVFoundation for media processing, and Metal Performance Shaders for GPU acceleration.

node.title: Core Audio Integration
node.comment: Implement native Core Audio APIs for superior audio input/output handling. This provides better microphone access, lower latency for real-time transcription, and automatic audio device switching that matches system preferences.

node.title: Metal Performance Shaders GPU Acceleration
node.comment: Utilize Metal Performance Shaders for Whisper model inference on Apple Silicon. This provides significant speed advantages over generic GPU computing approaches and matches MacWhisper's performance claims.

node.title: AVFoundation Media Processing
node.comment: Use AVFoundation for robust media file handling and format conversion. This provides better compatibility with macOS audio/video formats and automatic metadata extraction.

node.title: macOS UI/UX Native Patterns
node.comment: Implement macOS-specific UI patterns that make the application feel authentically native. Mac users have strong expectations for interface consistency with system conventions.

node.title: Native macOS Menu Bar Integration
node.comment: Implement comprehensive menu bar with standard macOS menu organization: File, Edit, View, Tools, Window, Help. Include standard keyboard shortcuts (Cmd+O, Cmd+S, Cmd+W) that Mac users expect for file operations.

node.title: macOS Toolbar & Touch Bar Support
node.comment: Design native macOS toolbar with customizable buttons for frequent actions. Include Touch Bar support for MacBook Pro users with contextual controls during transcription and editing processes.

node.title: Native macOS Dialog & Sheet Patterns
node.comment: Use native NSOpenPanel, NSSavePanel, and sheet-style dialogs that slide down from the title bar. Mac users expect specific dialog behaviors and button ordering (Cancel/OK rather than OK/Cancel).

node.title: macOS Dark Mode & Accent Color Integration
node.comment: Implement automatic dark/light mode switching based on system preferences. Use system accent colors and vibrancy effects where appropriate to match user's personalized macOS appearance.

node.title: File System & Workflow Integration
node.comment: Deep integration with macOS file system and user workflows that creates convenience and switching costs. These integrations make VoiceFlow part of the user's daily Mac workflow.

node.title: Finder Integration & Quick Actions
node.comment: Register file type associations for common audio formats and add Finder Quick Actions for right-click transcription. Users should be able to right-click any audio file in Finder and select "Transcribe with VoiceFlow".

node.title: Spotlight Integration
node.comment: Make transcripts searchable through Spotlight by implementing proper metadata indexing. Users should be able to find transcripts by searching for content within them from Spotlight search.

node.title: Services Menu Integration
node.comment: Add VoiceFlow services to the macOS Services menu for transcribing selected audio files from any application. This provides system-wide access to transcription functionality.

node.title: iCloud Drive Integration
node.comment: Integrate with iCloud Drive for automatic transcript backup and cross-device sync. This provides seamless access to transcripts across Mac, iPhone, and iPad without requiring separate cloud service signup.

node.title: Performance Optimization for Mac
node.comment: Optimize performance specifically for Mac hardware characteristics, especially Apple Silicon. Performance advantages create compelling reasons to choose VoiceFlow over competitors.

node.title: Apple Silicon Optimization
node.comment: Leverage unique capabilities of Apple Silicon M-series chips for superior transcription performance. This includes Neural Engine utilization and unified memory architecture advantages.

node.title: Neural Engine Acceleration
node.comment: Investigate and implement Neural Engine acceleration for Whisper model inference. This could provide significant speed advantages over GPU-only approaches, especially for real-time transcription.

node.title: Unified Memory Architecture Optimization
node.comment: Optimize memory usage patterns for Apple Silicon's unified memory architecture. This allows larger models to run efficiently and enables better multitasking during transcription.

node.title: Energy Efficiency Optimization
node.comment: Optimize for macOS energy efficiency to maintain performance during battery operation. Include low-power mode that adjusts transcription quality/speed based on battery level and power source.

node.title: Intel Mac Compatibility
node.comment: Ensure optimal performance on Intel-based Macs while prioritizing Apple Silicon. Many professional users still use Intel Macs and represent significant market opportunity.

node.title: Intel GPU Acceleration
node.comment: Implement GPU acceleration for Intel integrated and discrete graphics. This ensures competitive performance on Intel Macs compared to MacWhisper and other competitors.

node.title: Rosetta 2 Performance Testing
node.comment: Test and optimize performance when running on Apple Silicon under Rosetta 2 translation. Ensure graceful fallback performance if native Apple Silicon builds encounter issues.

node.title: Mac-Specific Feature Implementation
node.comment: Implement features that leverage unique Mac capabilities and address specific Mac user workflows. These features differentiate VoiceFlow from cross-platform competitors.

node.title: System Audio Capture
node.comment: Implement system audio capture for transcribing Zoom meetings, online courses, and system playback. This is a key feature that MacWhisper offers and users frequently request.

node.title: Audio Hijack Integration
node.comment: Integrate with or replicate Audio Hijack functionality for capturing audio from specific applications. Allow users to transcribe Zoom meetings, Spotify podcasts, or YouTube videos directly.

node.title: Screen Recording Audio Extraction
node.comment: Enable extracting audio from QuickTime screen recordings and transcribing them. This supports common workflow of recording meetings/presentations and later transcribing them.

node.title: Siri Shortcuts & Automation Integration
node.comment: Create Siri Shortcuts for common transcription tasks and integrate with macOS automation tools. This enables voice-activated transcription and workflow automation.

node.title: Voice Command Transcription
node.comment: Implement Siri Shortcuts for "Hey Siri, transcribe my last recording" or "Hey Siri, start transcribing". This provides hands-free operation for accessibility and convenience.

node.title: Automator Workflow Actions
node.comment: Create Automator actions for batch transcription workflows. Power users can create custom automation for processing multiple files with specific settings and export formats.

node.title: Mac Ecosystem Integration
node.comment: Integrate with other Mac applications and services that users commonly use in transcription workflows. This creates workflow stickiness and user convenience.

node.title: Apple Notes Integration
node.comment: Enable direct export to Apple Notes with proper formatting and timestamp linking. Many users want to append transcripts to existing meeting notes or project documentation.

node.title: Calendar Event Integration
node.comment: Integrate with Calendar.app to automatically name transcripts based on concurrent calendar events. If user transcribes during "Team Meeting", suggest "Team Meeting - [Date]" as transcript title.

node.title: Contacts Integration
node.comment: Use Contacts.app for speaker identification in multi-person recordings. If user has contact information, attempt to identify speakers by voice characteristics or manual tagging.

node.title: Mac App Store & Distribution Strategy
node.comment: Prepare for Mac App Store submission and alternative distribution channels. Mac App Store provides legitimacy and discovery but has restrictions. Direct distribution offers more flexibility.

node.title: Mac App Store Compliance
node.comment: Ensure compliance with Mac App Store guidelines including sandboxing, entitlements, and privacy requirements. This may restrict some system integration features but provides legitimacy and easier discovery.

node.title: Sandboxing Strategy
node.comment: Implement App Sandbox compatibility while maintaining key functionality. Some features like system audio capture may require special entitlements or alternative implementations for App Store version.

node.title: Privacy Policy & Data Handling
node.comment: Develop comprehensive privacy policy emphasizing local processing and minimal data collection. Mac users are increasingly privacy-conscious, and offline processing is a key selling point.

node.title: Direct Distribution Option
node.comment: Prepare direct distribution infrastructure for users who want features that App Store restrictions prevent. This includes automatic updates, license verification, and download delivery.

node.title: Notarization & Code Signing
node.comment: Implement proper code signing and Apple notarization for direct distribution. This prevents macOS Gatekeeper warnings and provides user confidence in software authenticity.

node.title: Direct License Management
node.comment: Implement license key system for direct sales that doesn't require constant internet connectivity. Offline-first design extends to license verification to maintain functionality without network access.
